Many things had better never see the light of day. They are originated by minds that are not under the light of the Sun of righteousness. It increases the work of the Conference and it 
                                                                           473
might just as well be acted upon in their several churches and councils and take off the Conference a large amount of perplexing questions with which they should not be burdened. [Written in 1889, 12 years before the 1901 General Conference which made provision for Union Conferences.--A. L. White.] Let them be faithful stewards, to pray much, to work diligently, and act discreetly.
